section_items.caption:
**Description** for use on the {{ convention.name }} website. This information will be displayed on the page users see for the event. The description should be at least a couple of paragraphs, but can be as long as you like. This description is used to promote your session and attract attendees who will enjoy it.
You must use Markdown for formatting. [A quick primer on Markdown syntax is available here. ](https://en.support.wordpress.com/markdown-quick-reference/)

A **Short Blurb** (50 words or less) for the event to be used for the List of Events page and the convention program. Information in the Short Blurb must also be present in the (full) description above!

section_items.caption:
What kind of information would help you answer this question?

(For example, if you were holding a brainstorming session on ideas for a new campaign larp, you might want to know what sorts of things people would like to see but aren't available, and you might also want to know what's likely to influence them to sign up for a larp or not to.)

Please enter any additional information you wish to tell the Forum@Intercon staff.
This information will be shown only to the staff and will not be available publicly.

section_items.content: This information will only be used by the Forum@Intercon staff.

New for Intercon T: we'll be offering Forum session slots throughout the weekend in addition to Thursday and Friday. We'll prioritize filling Thursday and Friday, but also hope to have Forum content available during afternoon and evening weekend slots.

section_items.caption: Please pick your top three preferences for when you'd like to run your event. Please also mark all times when you will not be available to run your event.
If there are scheduling constraints on your event (for example, if are you proposing another event), or there are times your event cannot be scheduled, please discuss them here.
Please list any **Space Requirements** for your event.

Please list any **Sound Requirements** for your event.  If your event is going to be loud, or is going to run better in a quieter area, please let us know.  We run in shared space, with rooms near by each other, so perfect sound isolation is impossible, but we want to arrange events to not interfere with each other.
